job.description:
{"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "JobPosting", "datePosted": "2021-08-24T23:42:38.000Z", "description": "

MUST HAVES:

-           5+ Python software development for composition and modularity, debugging and following tracebacks

-           Strong stats background and concepts including hypothesis testing, correlation, R squared, P-value

-           Experience with Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, Pytorch

-           Tensorflow functional API, deep learning

-           Mathematics of machine learning- linear algebra, multivariable calculus

-           SQL querying

-           Hyperparameter optimization, regularizing regression models


PLUSSES:

-           Masters or PhD- HIGHLY preferred!!

-           Ecommerce experience

 

DAY TO DAY:   

A company is looking for a Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer to sit remotely within the US. We follow industry standard practices for managing, collaboration, deployment and testing. We deploy and interact with resources on AWS. 

Responsibilities include:

\u2022 Analyze large data sets by quantifying the data quality, identifying particular patterns, and visualizing results

\u2022 Understand business problems and identify the right data sets and ML/Statistical approach to produce the desired outcomes

\u2022 Adapt to account for changes and be able to propose alternative approaches

\u2022 Ideate and develop analytics and modeling solutions cross-functionally to build customized, long-term, and sustainable solutions

\u2022 Provide critical thought leadership and enhance organizational capabilities

\u2022 Own machine learning pipelines end-to-end

\u2022 Write production-grade machine learning code using standard engineering practices and deploy models to production

\u2022 Improve codebase and lead/participate in code reviews with Research Scientists and Data Scientists

\u2022 Help non-engineers develop their engineering skills

\u2022 Mentor junior team members and contribute to a culture where everyone is valued
